subject: Re: Frank Sumption and Bill Murphy on Darkness Radio- links for download
author: James W. Hyslope
full_text:
CORRECT...!!! Facto-Mundo... I have always had my opinion that "no matter" what anyone else states that they "hear" in there EVP's....this will NOT influence me as to what I hear. It is either there or it is not.To "matric" is not an option :)  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Fransen, Debbie" <debbie.fransen@...> wrote:
>
> I am sorry but I have to put my two cents in here.
> The more you listen to EVP's the more sensitive you become to what
> spirit is saying, so it 
> doesn't matter if someone tells you or not, you know what you heard
> whether it's the same or not.
> And the people who listen to Darkness radio surely know what EVP is, and
> about the paranormal.
> Most are not first time listeners, so how about we not make a big issue
> this time about how
> the audience could be manipulated because they said what the EVP's were
> supposed to be saying.
> I don't know why somebody always has to be critic. It is what it
> is........
> You either believe it or you don't.........
>  
> Great interview Frank,,, It's about time you came out of the
> basement.... LOL
>  
>  
>  
> 
> ________________________________
> 
> From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
> Of Rick
> Sent: Monday, August 03, 2009 2:53 PM
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank Sumption and Bill Murphy on Darkness Radio-
> links for download
> 
> 
>   
> 
> Unfortunately, the examples used were problematic.
> 
> You might notice they either played the EVP, then told the audience what
> the they were supposed to hear, and then played it again. Or told the
> audience what they were supposed to hear first. They never just played
> the sound (without the leading questions), and gave the audience some
> time to decide what it was saying on their own.
> 
> So while the history at the start was interesting, all the examples
> were, sadly, more examples of how people can fool themselves with
> pareidolia, than examples of spirit communications.
> 
> Note also, this also explains why prerecording noises, and using them
> later for the source of a Q/A session, still works. It's a tricky
> explanation when trying to explain how spirits are 'changing' the sounds
> at session time. But it is an easy explanation that it wouldn't matter
> whether the sounds were live or recorded, if it was just people hearing
> what they wanted to hear.
> 
> I realize that many people aren't out to prove anything, and that's
> fine: but in this case, it seemed a point of the interview was to
> demonstrate the efficacy of the box. In this case it would be better to
> either state they do not expect their examples to be prove anything, or
> if they expect to convince an audience, to use better testing of their
> results, and less leading of the audience.
> 
> imho
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> ,
> Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@> wrote:
> >
> > I agree with Shane. That was a great talk Frank S and Bill M.! Ib'd
> also like to thank Steve and Kristin for sharing some of your EVP
> results with them to use on the show. Those were some good examples of
> Frank's box and the sweep tuning method. 
> >  
> > I love it when people in this group work together towards our common
> goal. It's a wonderful example of teamwork and treating this research
> (and each other) with honesty and dignity, instead of some of the
> egotistical lies and deciet thats being spread around out there. It
> helps maintain focus and a better perspective on this subject. Great job
> everyone!
> >  
> > For those of you who missed the show you can download and listen here:
> >
